data.title: HOTEL LUX by Leander Haußmann
data.meta_description: In cooperation with the Goethe-Zentrum in Tirana HOTEL LUX Directed by Leander Haußmann 103 min, 2012 in German with English subtitles Cast: Michael Bully Herbig, Jürgen Vogel, Thekla Reuten, Alexander Senderowich, Valery Grishko, Juraj Kukura…   Berlin, 1933: Hans Zeisig and Siggi Meyer are a comedy act: At the Varieté…
data.text:
In cooperation with the Goethe-Zentrum in Tirana

HOTEL LUX

Directed by Leander Haußmann

103 min, 2012

in German with English subtitles

Cast: Michael Bully Herbig, Jürgen Vogel, Thekla Reuten, Alexander Senderowich, Valery Grishko, Juraj Kukura…

Berlin, 1933: Hans Zeisig and Siggi Meyer are a comedy act: At the Varieté Valetti, they do a brilliant parody of Hitler and Stalin – unperturbed by initial attempts to intimidate them. But that will not go on for much longer. Meyer goes into hiding in the Resistance, gets caught and is taken to a concentration camp. Zeisig is forced to flee with a false passport and ends up in Moscow, in the notorious immigrants’ hotel Lux. The Soviet secret services mistake him for Hitler’s renegade astrologer; Zeisig interprets the stars for Stalin and gets caught up in the power struggle between Stalin’s schemers. Zeisig loves Frida, an underground resistance fighter from Holland, who protects him until she lands herself in trouble. In the end, a dream comes true after all: In August 1939, on the day that Hitler’s foreign minister comes to Moscow to sign the non-aggression pact between Stalin and Hitler, Zeisig, Meyer and Frida manage to flee to Hollywood.

In cooperation with the Goethe Institute, the Goethe-Zentrum in Tirana and the Embassy of the Federal Republic of Germany in Albania, in the frame of the German Thursday Films program for academic year 2017-2018.
